description: Score a Y Combinator Spring 2026 application on a scale from 0 (reject) to 1 (accept). Evaluates six dimensions: founding team, progress and traction, idea and market, business model, application clarity, and competitive positioning. Each dimension is scored independently by an ensemble of LLMs and the final score is a profile-weighted average. Train a Profile on labeled applications to learn optimal dimension weights.

input_schema.description: A Y Combinator Spring 2026 application. Field names correspond to the actual YC application form.

company_description_short.description: Describe what your company does in 50 characters or less.

product_link.description: Link to the product, if any.

what_company_makes.description: What is your company going to make? Please describe your product and what it does or will do.

location.description: Where do you live now, and where would the company be based after YC? Format: City A, Country A / City B, Country B.

founders.description: The founding team. Must include at least one founder.

founder_title.description: Title at the company (e.g. CEO, CTO, CEO & CTO).

founder_bio.description: Background, relevant experience, education, and prior startup or industry experience.

founder_equity_pct.description: Equity ownership percentage for this founder.

who_writes_code.description: Who writes code, or does other technical work on your product? Was any of it done by a non-founder? Please explain.

looking_for_cofounder.description: Are you looking for a cofounder?

how_long_working.description: How long have each of you been working on this? How much of that has been full-time? Please explain.

tech_stack.description: What tech stack are you using, or planning to use, to build this product? Include AI models and AI coding tools you use.

previous_application_changes.description: If you are applying with the same idea as a previous batch, did anything change? If you applied with a different idea, why did you pivot and what did you learn from the last idea?

incubator_participation.description: If you have already participated or committed to participate in an incubator, accelerator, or pre-accelerator program, please tell us about it.

why_this_idea.description: Why did you pick this idea to work on? Do you have domain expertise in this area? How do you know people need what you're making?

competitors.description: Who are your competitors? What do you understand about your business that they don't?

how_make_money.description: How do or will you make money? How much could you make?

company_category.description: Which category best applies to your company?

other_ideas.description: If you had any other ideas you considered applying with, please list them.

legal_entity.description: Please list all legal entities you have and in what state or country each was formed.

equity_breakdown.description: Please describe the breakdown of the equity ownership in percentages among the founders, employees, and any other stockholders.

investment_taken.description: Have you taken any investment yet?

why_yc.description: What convinced you to apply to Y Combinator? Did someone encourage you to apply? Have you been to any YC events?

messages.content: You are an expert Y Combinator application reviewer evaluating the FOUNDING TEAM. YC heavily weights the team — a great team with a mediocre idea often outperforms a mediocre team with a great idea. Assess: (1) relevant domain expertise and technical depth, (2) complementarity of founders' backgrounds, (3) who writes code and whether technical work is founder-led, (4) equity split fairness and commitment signals, (5) whether this team is uniquely positioned to solve this problem. A solo founder looking for a cofounder is a yellow flag. Full-time commitment matters.

content.$starlark:
'Company: ' + input['company_name'] + '
What it makes: ' + input['what_company_makes'] + '

FOUNDERS:
' + '
---
'.join([('Name: ' + f['founder_name'] + '
Title: ' + f['founder_title'] + '
Bio: ' + f['founder_bio'] + ('
Equity: ' + str(f['founder_equity_pct']) + '%' if 'founder_equity_pct' in f and f['founder_equity_pct'] else '')) for f in input['founders']]) + '

Who writes code: ' + input['who_writes_code'] + '
Looking for cofounder: ' + (str(input['looking_for_cofounder']) if 'looking_for_cofounder' in input else 'Not specified') + '
How long working: ' + input['how_long_working'] + ('
Equity breakdown: ' + input['equity_breakdown'] if 'equity_breakdown' in input and input['equity_breakdown'] else '') + '

Rate this founding team:'

messages.content: You are an expert Y Combinator application reviewer evaluating PROGRESS AND TRACTION. YC values concrete evidence of execution over promises. Assess: (1) how far along the product is — idea vs prototype vs launched, (2) whether people are actually using the product, (3) whether there is revenue, (4) how long the founders have been working on it and time commitment, (5) technical stack choices and engineering sophistication, (6) speed of iteration. Even early-stage companies should show velocity and resourcefulness.

content.$starlark:
'Company: ' + input['company_name'] + '
Short description: ' + input['company_description_short'] + '
What it makes: ' + input['what_company_makes'] + '

How far along: ' + input['how_far_along'] + '
How long working: ' + input['how_long_working'] + '
Tech stack: ' + input['tech_stack'] + '
People using product: ' + (str(input['people_using_product']) if 'people_using_product' in input else 'Not specified') + '
Has revenue: ' + (str(input['has_revenue']) if 'has_revenue' in input else 'Not specified') + ('
Product URL: ' + input['product_link'] if 'product_link' in input and input['product_link'] else '') + ('
Previous application changes: ' + input['previous_application_changes'] if 'previous_application_changes' in input and input['previous_application_changes'] else '') + '

Rate this progress and traction:'

messages.content: You are an expert Y Combinator application reviewer evaluating the IDEA AND MARKET. Assess: (1) is this a real problem that people urgently need solved, (2) is the market large enough to build a billion-dollar company, (3) does the founder have genuine domain expertise or insight into why this idea matters, (4) is the timing right — why now, (5) is this a tarpit idea (sounds good but many have failed) or does it have a genuine novel angle. YC looks for ideas where the founder has an unfair insight or advantage.

content.$starlark:
'Company: ' + input['company_name'] + '
Short description: ' + input['company_description_short'] + '
What it makes: ' + input['what_company_makes'] + '

Why this idea: ' + input['why_this_idea'] + ('
Category: ' + input['company_category'] if 'company_category' in input and input['company_category'] else '') + ('
Other ideas considered: ' + input['other_ideas'] if 'other_ideas' in input and input['other_ideas'] else '') + '

Rate this idea and market:'

messages.content: You are an expert Y Combinator application reviewer evaluating the BUSINESS MODEL. Assess: (1) clarity and viability of the revenue model, (2) realistic estimation of revenue potential, (3) scalability of the model, (4) whether the founders understand their unit economics or path to revenue, (5) current fundraising status and investment history as signals of external validation. YC values founders who think clearly about how to make money, even if the current revenue is zero.

content.$starlark:
'Company: ' + input['company_name'] + '
What it makes: ' + input['what_company_makes'] + '

How make money: ' + input['how_make_money'] + '
Has revenue: ' + (str(input['has_revenue']) if 'has_revenue' in input else 'Not specified') + ('
Investment taken: ' + str(input['investment_taken']) if 'investment_taken' in input else '') + ('
Currently fundraising: ' + str(input['currently_fundraising']) if 'currently_fundraising' in input else '') + ('
Legal entity: ' + input['legal_entity'] if 'legal_entity' in input and input['legal_entity'] else '') + '

Rate this business model:'

messages.content: You are an expert Y Combinator application reviewer evaluating COMPETITIVE POSITIONING. Assess: (1) does the founder clearly understand who the competitors are, (2) do they articulate a genuine insight about the market that competitors miss, (3) is there a defensible moat or unique advantage, (4) is this a crowded space where differentiation is hard, (5) does the technical approach or product design create lasting competitive advantage. YC values founders who deeply understand their competitive landscape and have a non-obvious reason they will win.

content.$starlark:
'Company: ' + input['company_name'] + '
Short description: ' + input['company_description_short'] + '
What it makes: ' + input['what_company_makes'] + '

Competitors: ' + input['competitors'] + '
Tech stack: ' + input['tech_stack'] + '
Why this idea: ' + input['why_this_idea'] + '

Rate this competitive positioning:'

messages.content: You are an expert Y Combinator application reviewer evaluating APPLICATION CLARITY AND CONVICTION. This is about how well the founders communicate and think, not just what they say. Assess: (1) is the 50-character description crisp and compelling, (2) are the long-form answers clear, specific, and free of fluff, (3) do the founders demonstrate genuine conviction and deep thinking, (4) is the application internally consistent — does the story hold together, (5) does the motivation for applying to YC feel authentic. YC values founders who communicate with precision and show they have thought deeply about every aspect of their business.

content.$starlark:
'Company: ' + input['company_name'] + '
50-char description: ' + input['company_description_short'] + '
What it makes: ' + input['what_company_makes'] + '

Why this idea: ' + input['why_this_idea'] + '
Competitors: ' + input['competitors'] + '
How make money: ' + input['how_make_money'] + '
How far along: ' + input['how_far_along'] + ('
Why YC: ' + input['why_yc'] if 'why_yc' in input and input['why_yc'] else '') + ('
Location: ' + input['location'] if 'location' in input and input['location'] else '') + ('
Location reasoning: ' + input['location_reasoning'] if 'location_reasoning' in input and input['location_reasoning'] else '') + '

Rate this application's clarity and conviction:'
